website_summaries.verdict: A popular, lightweight option that is a top pick for small breeds.
pros: Customers note the compact yet sturdy design that collapses well
It also gets top marks for being easy to clean and carry, thanks to the included carabiners
cons: Can be used for a variety of dogs, but the smaller size tends to be best for small breeds
Occasional issues with materials not holding up

customer_reviews.title: Great product -> TIP for active dog owners
customer_reviews.text: I’m very active with my 3 year old husky. We always run together or hike up in the hills. These bowls are perfect for our trips. You can take them anywhere and are very easy to use. Whenever i’m hiking I also bring Paw Shield by PetSupply with me. This paw balm does a very good job when it comes to paw protection, which is very important for me. It heals and reliefs dry, cracked paws, as it is also a great paw moisturizer. Here is the link to Paw Shield:
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Light and compact
customer_reviews.text: The bowls are quite nice. Relatively small (see picture for scale) but they get the job done. We have a 60lb lab mix that has no trouble with them. For water if he's very thirst we just fill them up a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: East_coast_trials

customer_reviews.title: I have a GSD and these work fine. I keep these in the car
customer_reviews.text: Since the measurements are plainly listed, I don't know why people complain about the size. These are exactly as advertised. If you want a big dish, there are plenty on the market. I have a GSD and these work fine. I keep these in the car, my training bag, etc., in case I find myself unable to give my dog a drink when we're out and about. You don't need a big dish for that; you just refill until he's satisfied. Small is good. The dishes take up hardly any space.
customer_reviews.author: SandyStern

customer_reviews.title: Great small dog bowl set!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly. Colors great as pictured! Nice, no strong plastic odors. Very small, see photo. So, if your dog is an extremely small breed, this will be great for you!
customer_reviews.author: SummerDays

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great price and great quality! It's a pretty small bowl, but it's perfect for travel and our small Dachshund. We tested it and the product holds the same amount of food and water as described. The rubber is really durable and prevents the bowl from slipping on the ground. The bowls came in two separate plastic wraps and they're pretty easy to clean. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Abs Adriatic

customer_reviews.title: These have a strong chemical smell and cannot be returned!
customer_reviews.text: I really doubt that these are silicone and definitely not food grade. They have a strong chemical smell, even after washing with hot water and dish soap. I think these are misrepresented. Both dogs and cats have a strong sense of smell and I would think either would not want to eat or drink out of these bowls. Additionally, they are not returnable. Shame on Amazon for selling these and not offering a refund.
customer_reviews.author: EAS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Traveling with Animals
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these about 6 months ago prior to my husband and I moving across country. We moved from Nevada to Massachusetts, which is an all-day travel endeavor. We attached one collapsible bowl each to our cats' carriers and used them during our layover. They popped out easily and were perfect for mixing dehydrated food with water. I liked that there were different levels to pop them out at; the smallest was best for our kitties, and I'm sure the full extension would be better for large dog breeds. The collapsible containers cleaned easily and were ready to be stored once again for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Maguire

customer_reviews.title: NOT BPA FREE/Very Tiny Bowls
customer_reviews.text: These little bitty bowls are for very small dogs only. Not impressed with them at all. Would also recommend if you need a travel bowl to buy the fabric kind, as it is much more durable. These bowls are just folded plastic. Also, nowhere on the bowl is a BPA Free marking....therefore the seller's claims that these are BPA free are false. The fact that the seller is lying about the BPA free issue means these bowls are unsafe for pets period. Amazon should take action here.
customer_reviews.author: Toolman

customer_reviews.title: Conveinant, easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.text: Small, easy to grab and go. The silicone makes them easy to clean and keep clean over the cloth zip bowls. Purchased these over some other similiar bowls because of the carabiner clips. Makes them easier to travel with. I use them for my 86lb German Shepherded/Lab/Weimeraner. I keep both bowls in my car right now since my dog and I spend a lot of time traveling. I usually only take them out for outdoor training sessions, lodging, and hiking (dog carries in his own pack).
customer_reviews.author: Spork

customer_reviews.title: NOT SILICON!!! BE AWARE!
customer_reviews.text: Comsun 2-pack Collapsible Dog Bowl, Foldable Expandable Cup Dish for Pet Cat Food Water Feeding Portable Travel Bowl This is not food grade silicone. Based on our preliminary analysis, the silicone used for these bowls is not pure and the seller declined to answer what the filler and/or any other additional components mixed in with the silica. May potentially be toxic until exact information are disclosed. Do NOT buy.
customer_reviews.author: Miss S Giunta

customer_reviews.title: These are great for hiking and traveling
customer_reviews.text: I personally prefer these bowls over. The material of the Outward Hound bowl doesn't keep moisture from getting to the exterior of the bowl. So when they are done drinking and I have to store the bowl, it is now wet on the outside (which then makes whatever you are storing the bowl in wet). These bowls are perfect for taking to the park and on hikes, as they are used for dispersing water. The compactness of the bowls makes them perfect to attach to a water bottle or clip on their leash.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but easily damaged
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice and convenient, but not all that durable. I came back from the dog park to find the one I was carrying had torn along one of the creases, so now I can no longer use it. I'd only been using it for a week and a half. Luckily I have 2 more, but if those get torn too, I'll be buying a different brand to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: EstlinTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Let your dog drink normally in the field.  Don't just squirt water down their throat.
customer_reviews.text: Great hunting accessory. Many hunters just use a squeeze bottle and squirt the water down their dogs' throats in the field. I've seen many dogs gag and cough when being watered in the field in this manner. Taking a knee and providing a drink from a bowl clipped to your belt allows the dog to drink with his/her head down at their own pace. Take a minute. Look your dog's face, neck, shoulders over closely while they are getting a fresh drink. Use the time to think about your next move in the hunt. Pet your dog and praise the rather than just pouring water down their neck.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Bonner

customer_reviews.title: Lasts 20 months - great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of these bowls. The first was 20 months earlier. They will eventually tear where the folds are. I don't believe anything like this will survive constant bending and unbending forever so it's just a matter of time. The carabiners fail in a few weeks - the spring stops working. I just use key old key rings in their place - or better carabiners. For the price, these are great. A pair of better carabiners cost the same as these bowls and I don't believe any other bowl under $10 will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lau

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are exactly what I was looking for. As others have said, they are small, but that’s what I needed. I have two 15 pound dogs and I attach one of these bowls to my waist pack with the included carabiner when we go for walks. I just wanted to be able to give my dogs a small drink of water on longer walks and these bowls are the perfect size for that. I don’t need a large bowl that will waste more water. These are also a really nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: BRHubb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: These are small but hold my dog's regular 2-scoop meal and about a cup of water. They are great - collapsible, easy to clean, and don't seem to have an off taste. Although I have to admit, my dog is not a picky eater. We keep them in the door of the car so he'll have water when we take him somewhere. We first took the clips off because we didn't need them in the car, but when we went hiking they were nice to have to attach the bowls to our backpacks.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Product broke a week after return window and got minimal support. Dog also didn't eat from bowls.
customer_reviews.text: At first impressed with how quickly this arrives and the quality of the materials. However, just after the return window closed the green one broke so now I'm stuck with it and feel a bit cheated. On top of that; no matter what I tried, my dog wouldn't eat from these bowls. UPDATE - downgraded from 2 stars to 1: the company replied to my email after complaining about the poor quality and gave me a refund of $2.50 (purchase price was $14.94). Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jill & Joey

customer_reviews.title: Tore after a few days of use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for a trip, one used only for water and one for food. A few days into the trip, both bowls had tears in the folds. The one used for food had probably been opened and closed less than 10 times. Though they could still be used for food, I would not recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware - not returnable
customer_reviews.text: These were much smaller than I expected. When I tried to return (or even exchange for the larger size), I found out that these are not returnable. Had I known that, I wouldn’t have ordered them. Very disappointed with the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Broke too easily
customer_reviews.text: I loved these bowls when they came and was happy they were so lightweight, easy to use, etc. We attached them to my dog's vest as well as a small water bag and he was able to carry his own "supplies" while hiking. Unfortunately, he also broke both bowls just by drinking from them and pawing them when they were empty. Maybe my dog is just a huge beast (very possible), but either way, the bowls didn't last long. They were both broken within a couple months. But they are great if you want something lightweight and quick and are very convenient while they last!
customer_reviews.author: Leenbean

customer_reviews.title: Most have for animals lovets
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 dogs and walk them constantly. For animals lovers, this a most gave product We gave a small and middle size dogs and both can drink for it without problem. I like it because you can clip it in your belt loops or even in the dogs harness or leash. The price can’t be better. I looked in several stores in my home town and could not find it. So glad Amazon offers it
customer_reviews.author: Juanita robiou

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bowl find
customer_reviews.text: I got this to leave in my car as a portable bowl for my dog. I always carry water with me but forget he can't drink out of the container! This collapsible bowl is perfect. It folds very flat and fits in my glove compartment or center arm console. Very simple to open, stays up and easy for my dog to drink out of it. Dumping out or cleaning is very simple also. I was very happy that two came with this order and now we have one in each vehicle to make sure everyone is hydrated on car rides. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, heavier than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Weighs ~60g without the carabiner, which I find heavy for its size. If collapsibility is king, though, it seems to do its job well. That said, I bought these for potential backpacking use. But my existing, ~2x the volume, even sturdier, easier to clean, could-cook-in-it-in-a-pinch stainless bowl is only 80g so I will probably stay with the steel bowl. It's not hard to slip into my pack in between squishy things. In trying this one I realized that collapsibility, while cool, buys me too little and adds ridges where food can get stuck. (The steel bowl is here)
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: Great for on the go
customer_reviews.text: I like these collapsible bowls for feeding and watering my pup on the go. Honestly they are a little small for my pit bulls head but he has no trouble drinking from them. Eating is a little trickier for him but he makes it work. My family also have these bowls for backpacking and they work great for people too. Dog or person, we love that they collapse and and can be attached to the outside of a backpack or to our dogs vest.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy and hold up great! I use them in my Doggie Field Trip business. The previous ones I ordered on Amazon were flimsy and broke easily. These are holding up wonderfully! Now if I could just stop losing them. But at least they are a great deal compared to buying in pet stores. I did remove the tiny carabiners, put a keyring through the hole, and put on bigger keychain carabiners. That makes them perfect!
customer_reviews.author: MelK

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price for a 2 pack. This 2 pack is over half the price LESS than for 1 at the pet stores. I actually like these better because they are not as deep. For my dogs that's good because they are small dogs so i don't waste as much water if they don't drink it all. For larger dogs it could be a negative if you want the bowl to be deeper. The quality feels amazing. Highly recommend plus they also come with a hanging attachment which others i have from the pet stores do not.
customer_reviews.author: Jill4feet

customer_reviews.title: Good Price, Light Weight, Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: COMSUN Collapsible Dog Bowl, Food Grade Silicone BPA Free, Foldable Expandable Cup Dish for Pet Cat Food Water Feeding Portable Travel Bowl. These are great for travel use. Don't take a lot of space, light weight and easy to clean. Using the free included Carabineer I usually have these clipped to the cat carrier/backpack/ wire cage,wire door on front of hard sided carrier, cabinet handle, hooks inside storage areas.
customer_reviews.author: Cairo Desert Rose

customer_reviews.title: Way smaller than I imagined
customer_reviews.text: Good idea for these bowls for camping, hiking or to keep in the car or our RV, or so I thought. When I got them they are too small for most any dog to use and maybe too deep for the small dogs. I can’t use it to refresh my dog in the car because they are not sturdy or stable enough besides being just too small. Guess I’ll see if my grandson wants to chew on them, he’s teething...but not sure if they are a safe material.
customer_reviews.author: K. Aaland

customer_reviews.title: Camping - no problem!
customer_reviews.text: We use these for camping (also when we send the dogs to my sister inlaw’s for boarding when we go on vacation) and we love them! They’re super convenient, don’t take up much space, come clean super easily, and are dishwasher safe! They also don’t move around like other bowls I’ve used for them! I have small dogs and they eat from them without issue !
customer_reviews.author: L Capshaw

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Now that summer has arrived, I had been wanting to get these for my 8 month old corgi who had yet to experience the good old summer heat. They work great! They're light weight so I don't notice them hanging off the leash, they fold up nice and easy so we can move on with our walk, and they all stay rigid when they are extended so I can sit it on the ground if we're out at a park or some place where it can stay stationary for awhile. Highly recommend getting your pup this!
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla Crosby

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU LOVE YOUR DOG ... BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome. I clip it to my running (more like sashaying shorts), and off we go, easy to clean, pop open and ready to use. The dogs love it cause you are not wasting water on a long one having them try to drink out of the bottle or pouring into your hands. I recommend these to my students, for field use. Lightweight and honestly have had to look down to make sure was still there cause they are so light.
customer_reviews.author: Cutoff

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality and price... Plus you get two? Wow! These work wonderfully, we use them in car rides, on hikes, at the dog park, in the backyard, pretty much everywhere we can. The clips provided make it very easy to clip the bowl onto her harness, so that is a plus as well. They’re also compact enough to keep one in the glove box or center console in the car, and to hold one in the smallest pocket on my hiking bag. Planning to buy more, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kennedi GraceTop Contributor: Activewear

customer_reviews.title: Good for long dog walks where puppy gets thirsty
customer_reviews.text: We have these bowls everywhere (cars, dog backpack). Easy to clip onto your belt for taking the put out for a long walk. Unfortunately the carabiner clip on one of them won't lock/spring back to lock, so it's unusable. We'll figure out some way of attaching the bowl for the next hike. Bowls themselves are easy to use for both water and food.
customer_reviews.author: KBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: itss better for these to hve on hnd then the BIG ...
customer_reviews.text: i have recieved this for my dog 2days earlier then expected delivery date and it is very compact! itss better for these to hve on hnd then the BIG dog dishes i normally would have to carry with me.im constantly on the go so these were very handy caause i take my dog with me everywhere. due to his Seizures he gets,it made it hard to leave him home not knowing what will happen..so these bowls are very worth it and convenient! im rating 4stars cause i had the assumption that they came with LidCovers? they didnt,theyre just open bowls basically...but again it waas still that much more helpful,better then nothing...thank u aagain!
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Finally Feel Like a Better Dog Mom!
customer_reviews.text: I'm ashamed to admit how many times we have had to improvise doggie bowls for our pup. These seemed like a great solution, being able to collapse them and hook them on a bag has finally streamlined the process of keeping food and water readily available on the go. Planning on getting another set or two so we are sure to always have some no matter what vehicle we're in!
customer_reviews.author: ItalianCaliGirl

customer_reviews.title: For the pup on the move
customer_reviews.text: These are must-have if you go out-and-about with your pup! We attached one of these bowls to our leash, which is perfect for puppy hydration during hikes or long walks. We mostly use this at the beach for a portable bowl. The bowls are sturdy, and dry by themselves very easily. These are perfect for our small dog, although I imagine it'd only be a double-shot of water for bigger dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin RTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The bowls have been opened and closed at least a couple hundred times so far and as sturdy as day one
customer_reviews.text: If you have a pet...this is a MUST HAVE. We have a chihuahua so we got the small size. We can flatten the bowls out and put in the dog carrier or I hang the blows on my belt loop on my pants or hand on my purse when we go on hikes. The bowls have been opened and closed at least a couple hundred times so far and as sturdy as day one. Very affordable too for such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Living Free Forever

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Bowl
customer_reviews.text: Love this product for on the go! We live in a hot area and must have a way for the dog to drink at all times. I didn't realize how small they are (I have a large breed) so I refill it for him a few times before he's satisfied 😆. Good quality, colapses completely flat to for in a pocket or can use the d-ring to clip it to the outside of a bag
customer_reviews.author: Frank H. Gell III

customer_reviews.title: Happy Campers
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to use in our camper for our two small dogs (Chihuahua and Min Pin). Our camper is small, so space is at a premium. I have been trying to buy as many collapsible and space saving items as possible and these bowls were perfect. When needed, just pop them open and fill them up and we have two well-hydrated happy dogs! When leaving the campsite, we dry them out and fold them down and stow them away as they take up very little room! Great item!
customer_reviews.author: MB4

customer_reviews.title: Great for Keeping Dog Watered on the Move
customer_reviews.text: I keep one of these in the car, one on my dog's go-bag, and I gave a few others to friends with dogs. Compact and so useful. Never gets in the way. Big enough for my 80lb German Shepherd to drink from without wasting much water. Pour out any remaining water and keep moving. It does a good job and glad I purchased this. I used to keep plastic bowls in my car, but that was wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Brightly colored, traveling pet hydration solution!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit larger than I was hoping for, BUT it works great, is lightweight, colorful (so it’s easy to find if pup has moved it! Lol!) It pops open easily, which is good! A bit more challenging to flatten, but no biggie. You get two! Easy to wash, our doggie like it, and it solves the problem of how to give her water on hikes!
customer_reviews.author: Nance

customer_reviews.title: No cover, very small bowl
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sheltie, so not a big dog. They weren't kidding when they said this is suitable for cats--and maybe teeny dogs. The picture looked like it had a cover, which is why I bought it. I travel and wanted something i could put food or water in and not dump out afterward. This is not a travel bowl, and I can't think of another reason to have a collapsible bowl. I'm extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joi de Vivre

customer_reviews.title: Portable and the perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: I looked for a good portable dog bowl my dog would use. He seemed to be afraid of most of them. I found these and gave them a try. ...NO PROBLEM. It was like he always used this type. It is also fabulously portable, in that it clips onto my doggie bag I take with. I don't lose them! My only wish is that they had a bowl cover, but that is minimal on my request list. These are small, but is perfect for our 10 pound cavachon. These are great little bowls.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dickman

customer_reviews.title: Worth Buying!
customer_reviews.text: The bowls are very convenient for when we go on a trip for the weekend or even just to the beach. We’ve had them for several months now and haven’t had issues. They hold about 1-1 1/2 cups of puppy food in the bowl which is more than enough for our miniature dashchund. My only negative feedback is that the clips on both bowls broke, so we had to buy better ones. I would definitely reccommend any dog lover to invest in these, It’s worth it!
customer_reviews.author: dhandnf

customer_reviews.title: They're easy to wash and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my dog as we've started taking him on more hikes. They're easy to wash and easy to use. If I'm using it for water I'll usually just clip them onto my backpack and let it dry as we go. Super convenient to have as not all locations have doggy water fountains, and the fact that it comes in a pack of 2 is even better so you can use one for food & one for water on the go! My dog and I are extremely happy with these
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Keeping my dog hydrated!
customer_reviews.text: These are so great!!! My little pomchi is overweight and has a collapsing trachea so I have to take him on walks to lose weight, but he always struggles due to his breathing issues. This bowl has made me feel so much better about taking him on walks. I simply clip the bowl to the leash and bring a water bottle with me. Whenever he gets visibly thirsty, we take a break, I pop open the bowl and fill it with some water, and we are good to go. I feel so much better taking him on walks knowing that I can easily provide him with water. Love this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marianna Olesijuk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to attach to my emergency evacuation backpack. I clipped it to the side of the backpack. So my dogs can eat and drink when necessary. We are ready to leave at a second notice. This clipped with ease to a hiking backpack. They collapse very thinly and are quite compact. The bowls come with a carabiner for each bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: very helpful
customer_reviews.text: We live in the south (coastal Alabama), and summer heat is rough on our Husky/Border Collie Mix. Since we got these bowls, it's easy to take a bottle of water along and give her a drink - instead of pouring it into our hands and having most of it leak through before she gets enough. Aurora gives this 4 paws up!
customer_reviews.author: SaxPlayer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but carabiner is weak
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good for day trips and hikes. They collapse down into an almost-flat disc (maybe the width of a standard notebook), and pop right back up into shape. They're pretty small, so if you intend to feed a big dog lots of food or water and they're a sloppy eater, they're probably going to make a mess. The little carabiners that come on them are not well-made. I think one of them broke the very first time it was used, and now it won't latch anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Marlow

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is Well Made and designed. Folds flat and opens up easily. I can carry it with me in a smaller space and my dog readily uses it when I put water in. I am very happy with this product and it looks as if it will last a long time! I like to dry it out before folding it up because it goes in a bag and it "might" get moldy? I don't imagine it would hurt the rubber. Just something to consider if you fold it up wet all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Morgine

customer_reviews.title: Nice collapsibility and lightweight. However smaller than I hoped
customer_reviews.text: They are much smaller than I was hoping they would be, I have a medium to large size dog and the dishes are smaller than what he would need, but they are good for him to be able to carry in his backpack by himself and use when we are away from the house. I think they will still work fine even though they are a little small
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: it dries pretty quickly, and most of all I'm thankful for ...
customer_reviews.text: As a part-time dog walker, a collapsible water bowl is an absolute necessity, especially in the sweltering summer. I didn't have the highest expectations for these because they're so cheap, but after a few weeks of regular use I can say that I have no complaints. The size is reasonable (I've used it for tiny and large dogs), it dries pretty quickly, and most of all I'm thankful for the carrying loop and carabiner!! I pop them open for water breaks, dump out any leftovers, and hang them on the bottom of my pack until they dry out. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Angela F

customer_reviews.title: Good even for my big mush face
customer_reviews.text: These were just what I needed. I clip one onto my day back when I go hiking with my dog. My dog is a 75lb pitbull mix and this works great for him. I like these better than the material travel bowls because most of those have a narrow opening at the top which makes it hard for him to get his big mouth into, these have a nice wide opening so he can drink easily. He usually goes through filling it up one and a half times when we stop for water breaks but I'd rather fill it up twice than carry around a bigger one with me. I also keep one in my car :)
customer_reviews.author: Angela H

customer_reviews.title: A little smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my Labradoodle puppy. We keep one in each of our cars for when we are out of the house (since we always seem to forget a cup or something for him to drink out of). So far we’ve only used them a couple times but they work great and are sturdy. The carabiners come in handy for attaching to bags or purses. They are a little smaller than expected, perfect for a small or medium size dog, but they’ll do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: keri.lynn.n

customer_reviews.title: Keep in my car and pack
customer_reviews.text: I take my dogs everywhere I can. I keep a couple of these in the car and in my pack to help keep the dogs hydrated. They have been an asset many many times in 80*+ weather where my hounds can get very overheated when searching for critters on our hikes. I pop out the bowls, water the hounds up. flatten em back down and stuff em back into my pack and we are off to the next squirrel!! Owww-rrroooooo!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Kudos to the designer!
customer_reviews.text: We love these collapsible dog bowls and accompanying carabiner clips. Talk about handy! They are very well-made and lightweight. Because they are not cumbersome, we bring them with us on our daily hikes/walks. We've had ours for over a year and it still looks brand new. Most importantly, our dogs are not at all hesitant to drink (or eat) out of them. We also love that they are adjustable to different depths. Kudos to the designer of this product. Very important also is that they are made of human-grade/safe materials. Enthusiastically recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Flex!
customer_reviews.text: Rubbery enough to not even think about wearing a crack in it. Just enough plastic or whatever to give it shape and a little weight. The carabiner hook is an added bonus. It is metal. It's attached to the rim of the bowl which is made of plastic, not metal. However, it's a strong, durable, not gonna crack if I drop it, kind of plastic. Plus, you get 2. Totally pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Handy little dog bowl
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly as promised. I actually bought two sets. I have one clipped to each of my crates and X-pen and one hooked to my daypack. They are fairly sturdy and hold a decent amount of water. My dog might drink one of these down every hour, but this way I always at least have a water/food dish if I need it. The only problem and this is my problem of not reading as well as I could, is that these are smaller than I thought they'd be. But for the price and for the situation, they work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: RachelTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT foldable!
customer_reviews.text: I got my bowls today and I'm giving them 2 stars because I am disappointed in the fact that they are not foldable. These are collapsible only. I specifically wanted it to fold so that it would fit perfectly in my fanny pack. Not worth returning. I'll just give them away and search for another. The black rim is hard plastic and the rest is like a silicone. I took the pic next to a 6oz container so that you could see the size
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: These are great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: These are great for hiking, long walks, and travel. Well-made and easy to squish into a purse or hang on the straps of a backpack. I have a 22-pound italian greyhound mix, and these are a perfect size for her food and water needs. Only potential downside- on one walk I tried to share water with my friend's 60-pound lab mix, and her snout was too large to comfortably fit in the bowl, so I'd look for something bigger for a larger dog.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer McCord

customer_reviews.title: Food Grade Silicone BPA Free FDA Approved or Not??
customer_reviews.text: While these bowls appear to be well made, I am really disappointed that there is nothing on the wrapping, box or bowls mentioning a thing about being Food Grade Silicone BPA Free FDA Approved, as was stated, which is the only reason I purchased them to begin with. For that reason, I am still not sure if I will keep them or return them.
customer_reviews.author: Pat C

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bowls that hold up well and travel easily
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are great for traveling. They are very sturdy when you set them up, but you can easily collapse them down to flat when you're ready to go. I ended up using them as my dog's food and water bowls for a week while we were staying with family, and they held up great. My dog is 15 lbs, and these were about the size of his regular bowls (maybe slightly bigger). My family's 50-60 lb dog also ate and drank out of them without any issues, but he would likely need them re-filled a lot more often if using them for more than just when you're on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Cesaco

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pet bowls for travel
customer_reviews.text: Great collapsible dog bowls! Ordered for a road trip and recent vacation! Love the convenience that they have a clip that attaches to them. So convenient. We attached the bowls to the dogs leash, so when we were walking her, and we had our bottled water, we were able to just pop off the leash and pour water for her wherever we were! Plus having them attached to dogs leash, I knew EXACTLY where they were at all times.
customer_reviews.author: DRB

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this for small/medium dogs
customer_reviews.text: I did not pay attention to the sizing of this before ordering - my fault. I received it today and it is too small for my 60lb dog. I would recommend this for small/medium dogs. It looks to be of great quality and I love the clips to be able to attach them to my backpack. I only gave three stars because it is still sealed in plastic (unopened) and they would not allow me the option to return this item. Next time, I will make sure to read the dimensions! I've already order a bigger bowl from a different seller and can't wait to put it to good use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bowl
customer_reviews.text: First order we placed had some trouble with the packaging, but upon messaging the seller, they immediately sent a replacement! They are very easy to work with. As for the bowls, they're great. I have a small dog and she loves going out with us. The bowl is very convenient for purses, glove box, doggie backpack, really anywhere. They're easy to use and very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Ingeborg Zandee

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good addition to your emergency pet supplies.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this be able to have a bowl for my cats when we travel. Collapsing is easy to do but it's firm and rigid when popped out. I clip it to the outside of their carriers so if we and the cats have to get out quick, I still have bowls for them. Since we have two cats, having a pack of two different colored bowls makes this convenient for the two-cat households. And if you were using one for water and one for food, you can avoid mixing and contamination.
customer_reviews.author: MongrelRaider

customer_reviews.title: Great water bowl for my dog & great camping bowl for me!
customer_reviews.text: I generally use these to serve my dog water when out and about - they're so easy to throw into a bag so I carry them with me whether on a hike or long walks. But I've also started using them for myself when camping since they're nice little portable reusable bowls. Not much more to say but feel like these have served me very well and are so cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Richa

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: These are the best travel dog bowls around. You can't beat the price. They're light and very easy to clean. The clip that comes with is also great for attaching to a travel bag, or your dog's harness/vest (which we did while we were hiking. We got lots of compliments at how great it was our dog was able to carry around his own water dish).
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received mine today and couldn't be more pleased. I know once of the complaints online were that ehy were too small. As I have a small dog, I thought they were perfect. Even for a midsized dog they are great and for the price, you cant beat them/ They colapse easy for storage when I take my dog to the park and are much thinner than the book I am reading!
customer_reviews.author: aunt emma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little bowls
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little collapsible bowls. I keep them in the car and when I take my pup out to eat, to a friends, hiking or even the park I always have a way to make sure he gets food or water on-the-go. Easy to clean and then just store away. Can also be used for, everyday needs as they are perfrct when I take him with me on business trips, excellent travel size:)
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what not to like about this very simple product. It’s well made. I don’t know what other talking about food graded silicon, smell and stuff. It doesn’t smell. It’s for dog to take a quick drink on the walk, not for babies formula. Dogs drink out of puddle, yet people concerned about food graded silicon. I would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kirill K.

customer_reviews.title: Good product (x 2)
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, collapsible bowl with a handle and a small carabiner to hook to your belt or bait bag. It is easy to carry or store in your car, but too large to fit in my bait bag. Instead, it clips onto a loop. I gave it 4 stars instead of five because the carabiner is not strong; it broke on my first trip out. The package contains two of the bowls, and a replacement carabiner is an easy and cheap thing to replace. I consider it a very good purchase for a good price. All three of my dogs, ranging from 17 to 60 pounds, drank readily from a bowl during a walk.
customer_reviews.author: Westie Mom

customer_reviews.title: collapsible pet food & water bowls
customer_reviews.text: What a handy space-saver! And dish washer safe, too. These collapsible pet bowls fit into the small pockets of your pet carrier, or just pop 'em in your purse or your glove compartment in your car. Bring along a ziplock sandwich baggie to seal it into after you use it when traveling. Then you can wash it later when you have a sink or a dish washer to use. LOVE THESE!!!
customer_reviews.author: T.H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken, when I first went to open this very small, holds 1 C of water, bowl it was broken! The whole point of it is that it collapses and can attach to the leash, well the part that connects it to the leash was detached from the bowl. Went to where you can return or replace item and it just said the item is non-returnable. Very dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great for travelers!
customer_reviews.text: We travel A Lot and take our chihuahuas with us everywhere with us. These come in handy in the woods, the city or which ever hotel we are staying at. The only issue I’ve started to see is that the blue bowl is kind of drying out and leaving white marks IN the plastic. So far so good, they haven’t cracked or sprung any leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these little travel bowls
customer_reviews.text: These are great little bowls! Very nicely made, and a great price for the set. You can collapse them partially for a smaller capacity or pop them all the way out to hold more. The added clips make them even more convenient to snap on a belt or backpack.
customer_reviews.author: jumpthewake

customer_reviews.title: We have a medium sized dog and while the bowls are pretty small, she has no problem using it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a couple months now and use them multiple times a week. No sign of damage yet, very convenient to use. We have a medium sized dog and while the bowls are pretty small, she has no problem using it for food or water temporarily, they might be too small for a big dog. Can be easy for dog to spill water out because of the size, but I mostly use them outside so it hasn't been a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Light, compact, easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought three for hiking - two for my dog, and one for hand washing or whatever else I might need a water basin for. They're very light and fit great into my dog's backpack, but if you have a very large dog, these might not be for you. Personally, I think the size is perfect. I have a 25lb German Shepherd/beagle mix, and he happily eats and drinks out of these when we stop for breaks. No leaks, carabineer clip is convenient. I would buy these again if they broke, but so far they seem like they'll last very well, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Must be really fun to chew
customer_reviews.text: I guess the bowl is super fun to chew, so my puppies destroyed the plastic ring on the top. Bowls are still functional with a little bit of extra work. If you have mischievous pups like I do might want to watch them when you have these bowls down for them to use. But I have no complaints, even after the dogs tore into them they're still functional and that's pretty impressive honestly!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Hill

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and compact
customer_reviews.text: These collapsible bowls are perfect for on the go dogs. I have a service dog and I love these bowls because they are compact and I can pop them up for giving my dog a drink or something to eat. They clean up easily and clip to her harness. My only complaint is that the caribiner clip that came with the bowls is small and thin, I plan to buy a bigger one that is a little sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: FatherBjornOES

customer_reviews.title: READ THE WHOLE PRODUCT DESCRIPTION BEFORE BUYING
customer_reviews.text: I got these to take hiking for my dogs water. I was in shock when I opened them and they were so small. It states this is a collapsible DOG bowl.....so it was my fault for not reading further where it states expandable cup dish for CAT...VERY MISLEADING...These might be good for a super small dog but def will not work for my 2 large dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Great dog bowls!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I clipped them to my backpack and off we go. I don't have to worry about having a larger dish with me for my dogs. This is just so much more compact. Perfect for water or food. Easy cleanup and it collapses easily for storage. You can also open it for a smaller bowl. I have a black lab & a jack russell terrorist (hehe - I laugh but it's fitting) and these are perfect for us!
customer_reviews.author: MrsFraQ

customer_reviews.title: Great water and food dish -- only so-so earrings
customer_reviews.text: Walking your dog is great exercise for both of you, but you need to keep hydrated, and so does your dog. You can drink straight from the bottle, but not the dog; they need a bowl. Just snap one of these handy bowls to your belt or the leash, and you're set. Going on a longer hike, take both for food and water. Your dog will thank you, and people will notice what a good dog parent you are! Okay, you've read this far to find out why only so-so earrings-- I just prefer them to match, not be different colors. But great for bowls!
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Disliking clutter, I used to just cup my hand and pour some water in for the boys to get a drink on long walks. But I decided to give these a try and really appreciate them. No muss, no fuss, no more slobber hand. Even with their huge German Shepherd snouts, they easily drink from these.
customer_reviews.author: We3GermanShepherds

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Camping, Hiking, Traveling...
customer_reviews.text: We have an Aussie Shepherd that is extremely food and water motivated; he also happens to love tent camping with us. These bowls appeared very small at first, but our dog's 1.5 cup serving of food fits with some extra space quite well. It's a little smaller for water than I'd like, but as long as you keep an eye on it and refill as needed, you'll be fine. I love that I can wash these easily, collapse them, and toss them into our camping supply box when we're back home. They also work great in a backpack or car when your buddy needs a quick drink of water. For this price, you really can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase. Durable
customer_reviews.text: We have had many dog bowls and the lighter weight rubber is so easy to tear that we decided this time we would go with a more heavy duty material. These bowls have withstood the dog park and countless hikes where the bowl may have been caught in boulders (hanging from th backpack). I like the bright color because it’s easy to find amongst all of my dogs things. Good purchase
customer_reviews.author: J. HallTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: size doesn't matter
customer_reviews.text: Small size is helpful for storage inside car door, purse, pants pockets, jacket, etc. Love that it folds to open and closes flat. Good travel bowl size for your convenience and any size dog's thirst while traveling with you. Quality material. Clever design.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wilke

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy;  Good size for a Med. / 25 pound dog
customer_reviews.text: We lost our dog's original water bowl, so we were happy to order a 2-pack. The bowls are sturdy, good quality and just the right size for our 25 pound dog. We go on long walks, so these are great to just throw in my bag and have for when he's ready for a water break.
customer_reviews.author: FIT85

customer_reviews.title: Awsome dog bowls.
customer_reviews.text: I love how durable these feel. They are perfect size, they hold just the right amount of water and food for my dogs. I like that i dont have to put them in bags i can just clip em on outside of my purse. Makes it perfect when i take them to the beach. The price is great for these two as well. Over all im glad i bought them. Will be using them whenever we go on trips.
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as shown
customer_reviews.text: The product recieve is EXACTLY as expected: Small, portable dog bowls. I purchased for my two medium sized dogs because when we go to the beach they need fresh water, but I did not want something too large. That's due to the fact that they get sand in it each time they drink, so I need to replace the water often. I have not tested yet, but they seem sturdy. Note the bottoms have a cute chihuahua outline
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: These are supposedly collapsable pet dishes. Maybe for hamsters or baby kittens. These are very small and on top of that i can't return them. Will be donating them to my local rescue shelter. Would not reccomend these unless your pets are very small. Not happy with return policy. I will add this company to my DO NOT BUY from list
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Shot glass for the dog :(
customer_reviews.text: Well if I’d been buying a water bowl for a guinea pig these would work great. The picture of the dog at this bowl full of food is not accurate. These are tiny. I could have read more on these but the picture and an amazons choice got me. Oh well my bad! Don’t make the same mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Madsen

customer_reviews.title: -) well it is more like one of those camel pack backpacks with a water ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't be the only one with a doggy diaper bag :-) well it is more like one of those camel pack backpacks with a water bladder that also has a spout nozzle so I can hydrate to the dogs. The original plan was for the dogs to drink directly out of the nozzle but One dog wants nothing to do with that. so we added one of these collapsible bowls to the outside of the diaper bag and it works perfectly! Doesn't take up too much room. Holds just enough water so we don't waste any on our longer hikes. And Daisy appreciates not having to drink out of the nozzle :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, exceeded my expectations. A pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.text: My dog thanks you. I use this with a bladder backpack. I fill it with ice cold water which keeps me cool and my dog gets frequent mouth fulls of Coldwater on the trail. Mouthfuls or water are much better than a stomach full. the mouthfull keeps him cooled of and he dring plenty of fresh cool water when he gets home. I was using this in Texas in 100 Degree temps.
customer_reviews.author: jojoRod

customer_reviews.title: Great dog bowls for a good price
customer_reviews.text: These are great little dog bowls, perfect for bringing on a long hike with the pup or for providing food or water at a rest stop during a long car ride. The reason that I knocked a star off is that the carabiner clips that come with the bowls are pretty cheap and one of them broke after just a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: IUhoosier10

customer_reviews.title: 2 pack collapsible dog bowl
customer_reviews.text: 2 pack Collapsible Dog Bowls great for travel or everyday walks. I use these to clip onto my purse when traveling with a pet and also have a spare in the car for local trips. Size perfect for a smaller dog (25 lbs) tho I have shared with larger dogs when on trips and its a good size and easy to use. The Caribeaners included make it easy to use and store.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to attach
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It makes walking the dog so much easier. I used to try to stuff a bulky container into my “dog walking sack” and now I can just throw this thing in there. It’s lightweight and I don’t even notice I’m carrying it. I love that I can also connect it to his dog leash if I don’t feel like carrying much on our walks. 5 stars from my pup and I!
customer_reviews.author: CyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: The one I got came with two blue and green collapsible dog bowls. They don't take up much space when collapsed, which is perfect for travel. It also can attach to something like a backpack with the carabiners included.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I have a medium sized mix (Lab, Pitt, German Shepherd). I have 4 of these bowls and keep them in the car, at home, in my hiking bag, and my purse. It's exactly the answer to what I needed to be able to give him a drink of water on the spot no matter where we are. I also use one of them to feed him when we're camping/hiking. I would definitely reorder!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Dog liked them
customer_reviews.text: Took these backpack camping with my best friend. She liked them and didn't hesitate to take food and water from them. A little small but actually held ample food for my 50# dog. Would buy again but might opt for a somewhat larger size.
customer_reviews.author: M. Galvin

product_meta.title: COMSUN Collapsible Dog Bowl, Foldable Expandable Cup Dish for Pet Cat Food Water Feeding Portable Travel Bowl Free Carabiner
product_meta.description: Size:Green + BlueCollapsible Dog Bowl, Food Grade Silicone BPA Free, Foldable Expandable Cup Dish for Pet Cat Food Water Feeding Portable Travel Bowl Blue and Green Free Carabiner ¡­

Safe materials and : made with high quality silicone. You also can rest assured that when your pet is enjoying Food or water from one of our bowls they're completely safe
Durable and reusable: the bowl's durable construction means that they can be rinsed or wiped clean after use. Also gives the bowl greater longevity over other similar products

Easy for storage and transportation: non-slip collapsible dog bowl set Great for travel dog bowl, Pet travel bowl and cat Food bowl - The bowls include color-matching carabineers clip it or collapse it to your backpack, purse, dog travel crate, dog training leash or collapse flat for your pocket, stroller, glovebox and more! Terrific pet supplies for dogs water bowl or dog travel bowl
Brightness color: color-a set with mixed color: Blue and Green. Lifetime , 100% money back .
